[SYNTAX]: Occasionally dense, archaic sentence structures (e.g., "They disarm Fortune by claiming freely as a right what she is accustomed to grant grudgingly as a favour—").
[LEXICON]: Formal, somewhat antiquated vocabulary ("dross of Reynolds' art," "moulding of his technique") may slightly impede modern readability.

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from discussing Reynolds' artistic development to analyzing his teaching approach (e.g., "Students of the famous discourses...").
[STRUCTURE]: Minor disjointedness in juxtaposing biographical events (e.g., health accidents in Minorca/Vatican) with broader artistic themes.

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally lengthy, complex sentence structures (e.g., subordinate clauses) that slightly impede immediate clarity.

[TRANSITION]: Mild abruptness in shifting from personal flaws to Leicester Square’s atmosphere, though contextually justified.
